translated: This method is the secret king of teachings, which is free from disputes,

original: / rtsod dus la chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: / rtsod dus la chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: and is for those who are attached to the age of conflict.

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi lam brgyags dang / ting nge 'dzin la blo gtad pa lhung ba can /
translated: It is for those who have lost the provisions of the path of merit, such as generosity, and the focus of the mind on samadhi,🔽and who have not obtained the fruit of the tree of virtue.

original: dge ba'i shing gi shing thog thob par mi 'gyur ba rnams yul gyi dgra yis dge ba'i bag chags phrogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyin ci log pa dang bcas pa'i gza' chen po babs par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ma shes pas yang dang yang
analyzed: dge ba'i shing gi shing thog thob par mi 'gyur ba rnams yul gyi dgra yis dge ba'i bag chags phrogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyin ci log pa dang bcas pa'i gza' chen po babs par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ma shes pas yang dang yang
translated: It is for those who have been robbed of the latent tendencies of virtue by the enemy of objects, who are possessed by the great planet of error, and who do not know the path of nirvana.

original: du de kho nar 'khor bar gyur pa'i srid pa'i bde ba 'dod pa'i sha zas bslu bar byas pa dang / de nyid ma yin pa'i chags zhen mang po la gnas pa dang / res 'ga' gnas skabs kyi bde ba bag tsam yang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i srid pa gsum la gnas par 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten rnams //
analyzed: du de kho nar 'khor bar gyur pa'i srid pa'i bde ba 'dod pa'i sha zas bslu bar byas pa dang / de nyid ma yin pa'i chags zhen mang po la gnas pa dang / res 'ga' gnas skabs kyi bde ba bag tsam yang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i srid pa gsum la gnas par 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten rnams //
translated: They are deceived by the flesh-eating demon of desire for the pleasures of existence, which is samsara itself; they remain in many attachments that are not reality; and they remain in the three existences, which are never even slightly happy.

original: sdug bsngal tsha ba kho nar zhugs pa de dag la byams pa'i snying rje'i grogs mo'i stobs kyis bde 'gror yongs su gzung ba med pa'i kun rdzogs kyis skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang yon tan dpag tu med pa'i gzhis gzhi 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsha ba kho nar zhugs pa de dag la byams pa'i snying rje'i grogs mo'i stobs kyis bde 'gror yongs su gzung ba med pa'i kun rdzogs kyis skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang yon tan dpag tu med pa'i gzhis gzhi 'dzin pa dang /
translated: With the power of the friend of loving compassion for those who are only in the heat of suffering, they take birth in the happy realms without being held by the perfection of non-apprehending emptiness. They take hold of the ground of immeasurable qualities.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bla na med pa nye bar ston pa dang / bskal ba dpag tu med par gzhan don byed pa'i snying rje'i brtul zhugs chen po 'dzin pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'char dpal 'khor lo sdom ba zhes bya ba he ru ka'i rgyal pos ji ltar snod du rung ba'i skye bo gdul ba'i bya ba'i thabs bstan🔽par 'dod pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bla na med pa nye bar ston pa dang / bskal ba dpag tu med par gzhan don byed pa'i snying rje'i brtul zhugs chen po 'dzin pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'char dpal 'khor lo sdom ba zhes bya ba he ru ka'i rgyal pos ji ltar snod du rung ba'i skye bo gdul ba'i bya ba'i thabs bstan par 'dod pas /
translated: The glorious Bhagavan Vajradhara, the king of herukas, who teaches the unsurpassed path to nirvana and who takes up the great conduct of compassion that benefits others for countless eons, wishes to teach the method of the deeds to be performed for the sake of those disciples who are suitable vessels.🔽Because of his sharp faculties, he is very easy to train, so he is followed by the yoginis.

original: dbang po rno ba'i dbang gis rnal 'byor gyi lam kho nar shin tu sla bas rnal 'byor ma'i tshul gyis rjes su 'brangs pas g-yon pa'i spyod pas mdzes par 'gyur ba'i rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi gsang ba mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom pa'i rgyud ston pas
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i dbang gis rnal 'byor gyi lam kho nar shin tu sla bas rnal 'byor ma'i tshul gyis rjes su 'brangs pas g-yon pa'i spyod pas mdzes par 'gyur ba'i rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi gsang ba mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom pa'i rgyud ston pas
translated: The Bhagavan wishes to beautify him with left-hand conduct by teaching the secret of all yoginis, the tantra of the dakini net.

original: gsungs pa'o // rnyed par sla ba'i babs kyi man ngag rnyed par dka' ba thob par 'gyur zhes pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje phag mo'i lus can ma shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan to //🔽de'i gdul bya'i bsam pas phrin las kyi dbye ba @226a * //
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // rnyed par sla ba'i babs kyi man ngag rnyed par dka' ba thob par 'gyur zhes pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje phag mo'i lus can ma shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan to // de'i gdul bya'i bsam pas phrin las kyi dbye ba @226a * //
translated: The Blessed One has taught the nature of all phenomena, the reality of Vajravārāhī, who is the embodiment of the absence of intrinsic existence, who is the nature of wisdom, as “attained through the attainment of the esoteric instruction that is easy to obtain and difficult to obtain.”

original: rnam pa dpag tu med pa mthong bar gyur kyang 'dir ni rnam pa de dag gtsor bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dpag tu med pa mthong bar gyur kyang 'dir ni rnam pa de dag gtsor bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Although the Blessed One has seen the immeasurable varieties of the divisions of activity according to the inclinations of those to be tamed, here those varieties should not be taught as primary.

original: 'on te zhal gnyis phyag gnyis rdo rje lha mo gcig pu'i sgrub thabs mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'on te zhal gnyis phyag gnyis rdo rje lha mo gcig pu'i sgrub thabs mngon par brjod do //
translated: Or, the single deity of the Vajra Goddess with two faces and two arms is taught in the ritual formulation.

original: de ni rgyud mang po la nye bar bstan pa'i de nyid ma lus pa so sor thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi cho ga mkhyen pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs kyis rgyal po chen po aindra bh'u ti zhabs kyis rang gi rtogs par gyur
analyzed: de ni rgyud mang po la nye bar bstan pa'i de nyid ma lus pa so sor thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi cho ga mkhyen pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs kyis rgyal po chen po aindra bh'u ti zhabs kyis rang gi rtogs par gyur
translated: The great king Indrabhūti, having attained the great siddhi of Mahāmudrā, the method of accomplishing the means of attaining all the essential points taught in many tantras,

original: pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i gsang ba mngon par brjod pas dang po don chen po'i dngos sgrub kyi rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i gsang ba mngon par brjod pas dang po don chen po'i dngos sgrub kyi rgyu yin pas //
translated: the secret of the ḍākinīs, the characteristics of the path, which is the cause of the great meaning in the beginning,

original: 'gro ba 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub thabs dang / de'i sngags kyi btu ba dang / bzlas pa'i cho ga dang / 'khor lo mchod pa'i las rnams dang / lhag mas spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub thabs dang / de'i sngags kyi btu ba dang / bzlas pa'i cho ga dang / 'khor lo mchod pa'i las rnams dang / lhag mas spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: the method of subduing migrating beings, the means of accomplishing Vajrayoginī, the collection of her mantras, the rite of recitation, the rite of worshipping the wheel, and the characteristics of enjoying the leftovers should be explained.

original: de'i phyir dang por 'dir rnal 'byor ma yi dam lha'i bar chad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i don chen po tshogs par byed pa'i phyag 'tshal ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por 'dir rnal 'byor ma yi dam lha'i bar chad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i don chen po tshogs par byed pa'i phyag 'tshal ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, first here is the homage that is stated for the sake of completely pacifying all obstacles to the pledged deity yoginī, which is the great purpose of the assembly.

original: bdud ces pa la sogs pas rdo rje ni spros pa dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin kyang yin la sbyor ba yang yin no //
analyzed: bdud ces pa la sogs pas rdo rje ni spros pa dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin kyang yin la sbyor ba yang yin no //
translated: The vajra is the nature of the wisdom free from elaborations, and it is also the yoga.

original: thabs shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa yang yin no //
analyzed: thabs shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the meditative equipoise of method and wisdom.

original: de yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las /
analyzed: de yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las /
translated: Moreover, in the Continuation of the Glorious Guhyasamāja Tantra it is said:

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: The meditative equipoise of method and wisdom

original: rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: is called “yoga.”

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab dang // thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab dang // thabs ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Wisdom is the non-entity, and method is the characteristic of entity.

original: de 'di la yod pas rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: Since this exists for her, she is Vajrayoginī.

original: yang na rnal 'byor ba de 'dis snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ba de 'dis snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Alternatively, since the yogin is equipoised by this, yoga is nondual wisdom.

original: de 'di la rang bzhin gyis yod pas rnal 'byor ma ni rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: de 'di la rang bzhin gyis yod pas rnal 'byor ma ni rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: She is a yoginī because she naturally possesses this vajra.

original: yang na rnal 'byor bar bya ba ni brten par bya bas rnal 'byor ni padma'o //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor bar bya ba ni brten par bya bas rnal 'byor ni padma'o //
translated: Or else, the yoginī is the lotus, because it is to be relied upon in yoga.

original: de 'di la yod pas rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: She is a yoginī because she possesses this.

original: bye brag gi brten pa'i rnam par gcod pa'i don du rdo rjes gong bzhin du khyad par ro //
analyzed: bye brag gi brten pa'i rnam par gcod pa'i don du rdo rjes gong bzhin du khyad par ro //
translated: The word vajra is a qualifier, as before, in order to distinguish it from other kinds of reliance.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bla na med par sbyor ba'i phyir dang // tshogs gnyis sbyor ba'i phyir dang // gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sbyor ba'i phyir dpal yang de /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bla na med par sbyor ba'i phyir dang // tshogs gnyis sbyor ba'i phyir dang // gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sbyor ba'i phyir dpal yang de /
translated: She is glorious because she is endowed with the highest excellence for the benefit of self and others, because she is endowed with the two stores, and because she is endowed with nondual intuition.🔽She is a vajra yoginī because she is a yoginī of the vajra.

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor pa yang de yin pas dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor pa yang de yin pas dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: She is glorious Vajrayoginī.

original: de ji lta bu @226b yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu @226b yin zhe na /
translated: What is she like?

original: stong nyid ni chos thams cad spros pa dang bral ba nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can shes rab bo //
analyzed: stong nyid ni chos thams cad spros pa dang bral ba nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can shes rab bo //
translated: Emptiness is wisdom, the nature of the realization of the freedom from conceptual elaboration of all things.

original: snying rje ni dmigs pa med pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo thabs so //
analyzed: snying rje ni dmigs pa med pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo thabs so //
translated: Compassion is the means, the nature of innate great bliss, which acts for the sake of all sentient beings without exception, without reference.

original: de yang stong nyid snying rje thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa gang gi bdag nyid de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang stong nyid snying rje thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa gang gi bdag nyid de de bzhin no //
translated: And that is just so, in the sense that it is the identity of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, of means and knowledge.

original: yang ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhe na //
translated: And how is that?

original: khams gsum ni 'dod khams gzugs khams gzugs med kyi khams ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje de gang gis bdag nyid de de bzhin no //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'dod khams gzugs khams gzugs med kyi khams ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje de gang gis bdag nyid de de bzhin no //
translated: The three realms are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm, which are the vajra of enlightened body, speech, and mind, and that is just so, in the sense that it is the identity of those.

original: sku gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is the nature of the indivisibility of the three bodies.

original: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: 'bar ba ni gsal ba bskal ba'i me'i 'od ltar gang gi 'od de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni gsal ba bskal ba'i me'i 'od ltar gang gi 'od de de bzhin no //
translated: Blazing is shining, like the light of the fire of the eon, and that is just so, in the sense that it is the light of that.

original: mi shes pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa'i 'od kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa'i 'od kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is the nature of the light that removes the darkness of ignorance.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor ma de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor ma de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one should pay homage to that yoginī who is like that.

original: yang na spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin stong nyid dang snying rje zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: yang na spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin stong nyid dang snying rje zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: Or else, it is Vajrayoginī, the union of emptiness and compassion, the nature of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin mi zad pa bde ba mchog gi rang bzhin yin pas lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin mi zad pa bde ba mchog gi rang bzhin yin pas lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the innate body, because it is the nature of supreme bliss, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: stong nyid snying rje'i bdag nyid ces pa ni yang don de ni don gzhan rten pas bzlas par bya ba'i rigs pas zab pa dang // rgya che ba'i rang bzhin gyis sems rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje'i bdag nyid ces pa ni yang don de ni don gzhan rten pas bzlas par bya ba'i rigs pas zab pa dang // rgya che ba'i rang bzhin gyis sems rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the dharmakāya is the emptiness and compassion nature, because that meaning is the nature of the profound and vast, which is the nature of the dharmakāya, the essence of the completely pure mind, by the reasoning of the repetition of another meaning.

original: sems can gyi don du khams gsum la thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyis rtag par byed pas khams gsum pa'i ngo bo nyid ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du khams gsum la thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyis rtag par byed pas khams gsum pa'i ngo bo nyid ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the saṃbhogakāya is the nature of the three realms, because it is the nature of the saṃbhogakāya, which is the nature of the dharmakāya, which is the essence of the completely pure mind, by the reasoning of the repetition of another meaning.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa nyid dang bral bas khams gsum la sku'i 'od zer gyis rab tu gsal ba'i phyir bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa nyid dang bral bas khams gsum la sku'i 'od zer gyis rab tu gsal ba'i phyir bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it is free from obscuration together with its habitual tendencies, the light rays of the body illuminate the three realms. The blazing light like the fire at the end of the eon is the nature of the emanation body.

original: de lta bu'i sku bzhi'i rang bzhin yang bcom ldan 'das ma dpal rdo rje phag mo bshad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku bzhi'i rang bzhin yang bcom ldan 'das ma dpal rdo rje phag mo bshad ces gsungs so //
translated: The nature of these four bodies is also said to be the Bhagavatī Śrī Vajravārāhī.

original: yang na lte ba'i mtsho skyes ni kha gyen du gdengs pa dang // spyi bo'i mtsho skyes ni kha thur du bltas pa ae'i rnam pa zur gsum pa /
analyzed: yang na lte ba'i mtsho skyes ni kha gyen du gdengs pa dang // spyi bo'i mtsho skyes ni kha thur du bltas pa ae'i rnam pa zur gsum pa /
translated: Or else, the lotus at the navel is facing upward, and the lotus at the crown is facing downward, in the shape of an aiṃ syllable with three corners.

original: shes rab kyi ngo bor lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bor lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that it is the essence of wisdom.

original: snying ga'i mtsho skyes ni kha 'og tu lta ba dang // mgrin pa'i mtsho skyes ni kha gyen du gdengs pa'i bam yig gi rnam pa can zlum po thabs kyi rang bzhin no//
analyzed: snying ga'i mtsho skyes ni kha 'og tu lta ba dang // mgrin pa'i mtsho skyes ni kha gyen du gdengs pa'i bam yig gi rnam pa can zlum po thabs kyi rang bzhin no//
translated: The lotus at the heart is facing downward, and the lotus at the throat is facing upward, in the shape of a vaṃ syllable, round, and the nature of method.

original: @227a * // de bzhin du kha sbyor gyi rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: @227a * // de bzhin du kha sbyor gyi rgyud las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra says:

original: spyi bo lter gnas 'khor lo ni //
analyzed: spyi bo lter gnas 'khor lo ni //
translated: The wheel at the navel and the head

original: ae yi rnam can yang dag gnas //
analyzed: ae yi rnam can yang dag gnas //
translated: The form of the letter E is the true abode.🔽One should know the form of the letter Vaṃ

original: snying dang mgrin par gnas pa yi //🔽bam gyi rnam pa lta bur shes //
analyzed: snying dang mgrin par gnas pa yi // bam gyi rnam pa lta bur shes //

original: lam gyi chos rnams nye bar bstan pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par sbong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs rnams so //

translated: The dharmas of the path are taught to be the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, and the five powers.

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams so //

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams so //
translated: The Buddha dharmas are the ten powers and the four fearlessnesses.

original: yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How are they so?

analyzed: dur khrod la sogs pa ni ros bya ba byed pas dur khrod de /
translated: The charnel ground, etc., are so called because they are the places where the dead are disposed of.

analyzed: mgo med pa dang / gyen du bcings pa dang / nyal ba dang / rtse gcig pa la brtags pa rnams kyi rim pa bzhin @229a * //
translated: The headless, the bound, the sleeping, and the single-pointed are the four postures.

translated: One should go to a charnel ground, a mountain peak, a cave, the foot of a tree, a riverbank, the confluence of two rivers, a temple of Maheśvara,

original: khang stong dang / skyed mos tshal dang / 'khrug pa chen po byung ba'i sdod sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khang stong dang / skyed mos tshal dang / 'khrug pa chen po byung ba'i sdod sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: an empty house, a garden, a place where a great battle took place, and so forth.

original: de la dben pa'i gnas su 'jam pa'i gdan ro langs la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la dben pa'i gnas su 'jam pa'i gdan ro langs la sogs pa la /
translated: In an isolated place, on a soft seat such as a corpse,

original: rnal 'byor gyis rol pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje zung du 'jug pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis rol pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje zung du 'jug pa /
translated: the yogī should play with the union of emptiness and compassion.

original: rdo rje skyil krung gis gnas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung gis gnas pa /
translated: He should sit in the vajra posture,

original: sgal tshigs drang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya sna rtse la blta ba dang / smra ba bcad pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa'i rol pas bsdad pa'o //
analyzed: sgal tshigs drang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya sna rtse la blta ba dang / smra ba bcad pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa'i rol pas bsdad pa'o //
translated: with a straight spine, gazing at the tip of the nose with the mudrā of samādhi, observing silence, and remaining with a one-pointed mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rab tu bsngags pa zhes pa ni gnas pa dang nye ba'i gnas pa la sogs pa'i nang nas gnas rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa zhes pa ni gnas pa dang nye ba'i gnas pa la sogs pa'i nang nas gnas rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The most praised is the four types of abodes among the abodes, near-abodes, and so forth.

original: dz'a landha ra dang / au dyan dang / p'urna gi ri dang / k'a ma ru pa'o //
analyzed: dz'a landha ra dang / au dyan dang / p'urna gi ri dang / k'a ma ru pa'o //
translated: They are Jālandhara, Oḍiyāna, Pūrṇagiri, and Kāmarūpa.

original: de la ao di ya na'i dang po'i yi ge ni zla ba phyed dang thig le dang bcas pas /
analyzed: de la ao di ya na'i dang po'i yi ge ni zla ba phyed dang thig le dang bcas pas /
translated: There, the first letter of Oḍiyāna is the letter O with a half-moon and a drop.

original: aom gyi yi ge ni rab tu bsngags pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom gyi yi ge ni rab tu bsngags pa'i don to //
translated: The letter Oṃ is the meaning of the most praised.

original: sa bon des mtshon pas gnas ao di ya na'o //
analyzed: sa bon des mtshon pas gnas ao di ya na'o //
translated: Since it is indicated by that seed syllable, the abode is Oḍiyāna.

original: de la zhal mngon par phyogs pas bde bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la zhal mngon par phyogs pas bde bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: Since it faces the face, it has the meaning of bliss.

original: ci'i phyir nub phyogs su zhal lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nub phyogs su zhal lta zhe na /
translated: Why does it face the west?

original: au rgyan rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i zhal nas sgrub thabs 'di byung ba'i phyir dang / de la de yod pa dang / de la dad par byed pa rung ba'i phyir ro //

translated: Because this means of achievement arose from the face of Vajrayoginī in Oḍiyāna, and because it exists there, and because it is suitable to generate faith in it.

original: ci'i phyir 'dug par bya zhe na rang dang gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang gi phun sum tshogs pa de sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags gnyis spangs nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dug par bya zhe na rang dang gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang gi phun sum tshogs pa de sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags gnyis spangs nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa'o //
translated: One's own perfection and the perfection of others are the attainment of the Great Seal, having abandoned the two habitual tendencies along with the obscurations.

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni rtsol ba med pas sems can thams cad smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni rtsol ba med pas sems can thams cad smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: The perfection of others is the activity of ripening and liberating all sentient beings without effort.

original: yang na rang dang gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: yang na rang dang gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs so //
translated: Or else, one's own perfection and the perfection of others are the assemblies of mundane and supramundane qualities.

original: de dag mngon par mchod pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de dag mngon par mchod pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of manifesting those.

original: yang gad zhe na /
analyzed: yang gad zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i rjes su zhes pa smos pa ni 'dug pa'i rjes la sku gsung thugs kyi kun nas rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes su zhes pa smos pa ni 'dug pa'i rjes la sku gsung thugs kyi kun nas rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: After that refers to the time after sitting, in order to abandon thoughts of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgun 'brum dang / bu ram dang / 'bras 'dag las byung ba'i ma da na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgun 'brum dang / bu ram dang / 'bras 'dag las byung ba'i ma da na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of madana made from grapes, molasses, and rice,

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga dang bcas /
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa lnga dang bcas /
translated: together with the five nectars.

analyzed: nyid lag ni lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo rnams so //
translated: one should sprinkle the limbs, the navel, the heart, the throat, and the head.

analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag ste /

analyzed: lha'i rdzas de nyid kyis mchod pa'i rdzas ni mchod pa'i chad du rdzas te /
translated: The offering substances are the substances for offering,

analyzed: me tog dmar po la sogs pa la bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: which are the divine substances. One should sprinkle red flowers, and so on.

translated: After that means after the sprinkling, one should understand the fingers of the left hand and the palm of the hand.

analyzed: de la lag pa g-yon pa'i dbus dang / mthe'u chung dang / srin lag dang / gung mo dang / sdigs mdzub pa dang / mthe bo rnams la rim pa ji lta ba phag mo dang / gshin rje ma dang / rmongs byed ma dang /
translated: In the middle of the left hand, and on the little finger, ring finger, middle finger, index finger, and thumb, respectively, are the natures of Vārāhī, Yamī, Moharā,

translated: Jālinī, Saṃhāriṇī, and Caṇḍālī, red, blue, white, yellow, green, and smoky-gray.

original: aom bam ham yom /
analyzed: aom bam ham yom /
translated: Oṃ vaṃ haṃ yoṃ

original: hrim mom hrem hrim h'um h'um /
analyzed: hrim mom hrem hrim h'um h'um /
translated: hrīṃ moṃ hreṃ hriṃ hūṃ hūṃ🔽phaṭ phaṭ

analyzed: phat phat / ces pa'i yi ge 'di rnams kyis sbyangs te /

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug gi tshig gdags par byas te /

translated: Since these syllables of the six yoginīs are inseparable from the mantra deity, one should imagine that these mantras are the six yoginīs and make offerings, and so on.

original: zhes gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gdags par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be imagined.

analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags kyi chus bkrus pa kho na lus ngag yid gsum yongs su dag pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni 'di kho na nyid bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bsags pa'o //
translated: This is the accumulation of the collection of merit.

translated: Some, abandoning the sequence of the text, say this:🔽After the consecration of the divine water, one should meditate on the syllables of the mantra of the six yoginis on the fingers of the left hand, worship with the divine water, and with that very water sprinkle the limbs and minor limbs such as the navel.

original: de nas lha'i chu de kho nas me tog la sogs pa la bsad gtor bya zhing lha'i chu de nyid kyis g-yon ba'i srin lag gis chos 'byung bris la de'i dbus su dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma skad cig gi rnam pas bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i chu de kho nas me tog la sogs pa la bsad gtor bya zhing lha'i chu de nyid kyis g-yon ba'i srin lag gis chos 'byung bris la de'i dbus su dpal rdo rje rnal 'byor ma skad cig gi rnam pas bsgoms te /
translated: Then, with that very divine water, one should sprinkle the flowers, and so on, and with that very divine water, one should draw a source of phenomena with the left ring finger, and in the middle of that, one should meditate on glorious Vajrayoginī in an instant.

original: me tog la sogs @230a * //
analyzed: me tog la sogs @230a * //
translated: One should worship with flowers, etc.

original: pas mchod cing phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa nas btang snyoms kyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: pas mchod cing phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa nas btang snyoms kyi bar du bya'o //
translated: and make obeisance, etc. up to equanimity.

original: 'di ni skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs mi dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs mi dgos te /
translated: This does not require going for refuge, etc.

original: gang zag dbang po rab kyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zag dbang po rab kyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is for a person of highest acumen.

original: des na 'di nyid rang kho na dge ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: des na 'di nyid rang kho na dge ba'i tshogs so //
translated: Therefore, this is the very collection of virtue.

original: da ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rjes la ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i ched du stong pa nyid kyi don du bsgom pa ni dag pa gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rjes la ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i ched du stong pa nyid kyi don du bsgom pa ni dag pa gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, after the collection of merit, in order to accumulate the collection of wisdom, the meditation on emptiness is for the sake of the three purities.

original: de la 'dir stong pa nyid ji ltar bsgom pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med par bsgom pa nyid kyis thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i skye bo'i rgyu las byung ba'i dri ma dag pas so so skye bo'i phung por 'dzin pa yongs su spong ba
analyzed: de la 'dir stong pa nyid ji ltar bsgom pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med par bsgom pa nyid kyis thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i skye bo'i rgyu las byung ba'i dri ma dag pas so so skye bo'i phung por 'dzin pa yongs su spong ba
translated: Therein, the meditation on emptiness here is the purification of the stains arisen from the causes of the ordinary person, accumulated since beginningless time, by the very meditation on all phenomena as unreal,

original: sngon du 'gro bas bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyis lha bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro bas bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyis lha bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and one should meditate on the deity by way of the preliminaries and the two, the creation and completion stages.

original: 'dir gang gi phyir stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni rigs pa skabs kyis chos thams cad kyi gzung 'dzin gyis dben pa'i sems gcig pu'i ngo bo rnams la rang bzhin med pa ni stod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir gang gi phyir stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni rigs pa skabs kyis chos thams cad kyi gzung 'dzin gyis dben pa'i sems gcig pu'i ngo bo rnams la rang bzhin med pa ni stod pa nyid do //
translated: Here, because the meditation on emptiness is the meditation on the nature of mind alone, which is devoid of subject and object, it is emptiness.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol thams cad dang nang gi mig la sogs pa rnams kyis sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol thams cad dang nang gi mig la sogs pa rnams kyis sgro btags pa'o //
translated: Thus, all external things, such as blue, and internal things, such as the eyes, are imputed.

original: gang gi phyir sems las gzhan bems po rnams tha dad med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems las gzhan bems po rnams tha dad med do //
translated: Because there is no other matter apart from mind,

original: de med pas 'dzin pa'ang med do //
analyzed: de med pas 'dzin pa'ang med do //
translated: there is no apprehender.

original: sems gcig pu ngo bo gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gcig pu ngo bo gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a single mind has two natures.

original: 'on te sems tsam bden par gyur na de ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sems tsam bden par gyur na de ma yin te /
translated: If mind alone were real, that is not so,

original: chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas de la yang dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas de la yang dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things are included in it, and because it is understood to be unreal.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams dngos po med pa ste de'i phyir ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams dngos po med pa ste de'i phyir ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Because things are unreal, therefore they are unarisen.

original: de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis sgro btags pa thams cad kyi mun pa dang bral bas 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis sgro btags pa thams cad kyi mun pa dang bral bas 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: It is luminous, because it is free from the darkness of all the superimpositions of that.

original: gang gi phyir dang po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dang po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not produced in the beginning.
